mcqs.question: A lecture is being held by the consultant pathologist about the pathological features of Alzheimer's disease, includes a mention of eosinophilic, rod-shaped inclusions, composed primarily of actin, seen in the cytoplasm of neurons of the central nervous system of patients with Alzheimer's disease These bodies are also known as
mcqs.explanation: Hirano bodies, glassy, eosinophilic, rod-shaped inclusions, composed primarily of actin, seen in the cytoplasm of neurons of the central nervous system, chiefly the hippocampus, particularly in older persons; although they may occur in the absence of disease, they are more prevalent in patients with neurodegenerative disorders such as Alzheimer's disease
